duties_responsibilities.duty: Supports end-to-end administration of the company’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) and specific company compensation programs, policies and procedures according to the requirements of the programs and policies.
Works directly with third party administrators (TPA) as needed to ensure a high level of customer satisfaction and cost savings across Constellation.
Understands the end-to-end process and may create/design new processes.

Supports the administration of the company’s ESPP and compensation programs, primarily long-term incentive (LTI), deferred short-term incentive (STI) and annual incentive, but may include market pricing, salary administration, retention, and reward and recognition.
Supports management of TPAs as necessary and monitors compliance with contractual performance standards.
Supports administration of compensation-related planning tools and evaluates and interprets plan programs, policies, procedures, and contracts related to compensation.
Identifies, develops, and implements process improvements to ensure service levels and customer satisfaction are met.
Participates in job audits, analyses, governmental reporting, and surveys, and identifies controls to ensure compliance with any applicable requirements.
Self-audits and monitors operations to ensure controls are operating as designed.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in business administration, HR, accounting or related field or equivalent.
